Finding aid encoded by Valerie Higgins, Library/Archives, Indiana University, October 21, 2008

did.head: Summary Information
did.abstract: The Ralston, G. mss., 1916-1949, consists primarily of lantern slides collected by Glenn Ralston.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Glenn Ralston was an artist from Indiana who spent most of his professional life in New York City. During the 1970s and 1980s he was associated with the historic Astoria Studios. Ralston was also co-founder and trustee emeritus of the American Museum of the Moving Image.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following series: I. Motion pictures; II. Advertisements; III. Miscellaneous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Ralston, G. mss., 1916-1949, consists primarily of lantern slides collected by Glenn Ralston. Most of these slides were produced to be used in movie theatres to announce coming attractions and to advertise various products and services. A few informational slides are included, such as Silence, Children of Europe Need Your Help, Let Us Stand By President Wilson, and several offer song lyrics. In addition, there are 63 lantern slides pertaining to homeopathy. A sheet music cover and its copper printing plate for an unknown piece from the film The Emperor Waltz starring Bing Crosby and Joan Fontaine complete the collection.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library; however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Ralston, G. Mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

scopecontent.p: One slide for each title, unless otherwise indicated.
